resources.string:
Leaders for Tomorrow(LFT) is a not-for-profit youth movement established in india whose members mainly consist of college students between the ages 18 and 25.

 The DTU chapter of LFT was established in August 2015, with a mission to provide a platform where the youth can express their views, generate ideas, meet great leaders, learn new skills, take up social action and ignite the leader in them.

 We beleive that together we can usher in a great future for our nation if we work hand in hand to bring real social change.

"Igniting Young Minds" is a project undertaken to motivate college going youth to give 1 hour of their week to under privileged students at government schools and slum kids.\nWeekly programmes include social activities like cleanliness drives, adopt a plant, shramdaan, visit for passion and cultural competitions. \nFor more details, visit www.lft.org.in
You can message, follow and like us at www.facebook.com/lftdtu or email us:

LFT-DTU is a team of 139 members, determined to learn and spread an aptitude for Leadership. The turnout increases with every event we carry out! \nThough we all are \"one among many\", but to organise and manage all events, we have a dedicated team as follows:

Shweta Chaudhary
2nd year,ENE

Shivani Sazawal

We, at LFT-DTU, also focus on developing the all round personality of all our members.\n\nAlong with on field experience, we also organise regular workshops and interaction sessions. These skill development sessions include training in leadership skills, communication skills, public speaking, team effort and planning.

This life skill program of LFT is soon going to be launched in `our college.

We plan to send 10 of our volunteers, every week, to nearby slums and old age homes. Our volunteers would enlighten the children aged 6-12 belonging to lower socio- economic strata on various topics like sanitation, moral sciences, GK, english speaking skills etc.

We will also be providing them with some basic technical knowledge related to computers.

This will help our volunteers to strengthen their skills and also awaken their social consciousness. Thus with the help of these small steps we can contribute to the growth of our nation.
It means social service in the society and community for its development. Its a combination of words shram-labour and daan-contribution. It is basically the non- monetary contribution to the society
We conduct collection drives to bridge the gaps between haves and the have nots. One can collect books, clothes etc and provide them to the underprivileged.

Its said that cleanliness is next to godliness and to reinforce this age old adage this campaign has been launched. It is a symbolic effort aimed at reviving the consciousness towards the environment by solving the problem of littering and a myriad of its consequences

Adopt a plant is the green initiative of LFT - DTU aimed at making the youth realize the importance of our mother earth and curb global warming. This program will help the students to develop an ownership about our environment

Owing to the changing social scenario and media influence, a large section of the youth are being drawn into substance abuse and ragging just to appear cool. Thus to make a sustained impact on this situation through ADAR we would encourage them to have discussions on issues like alcoholism, smoking , drug abuse and ragging so that they can understand the side effects of these menaces and avoid them

Himanshu Mangla
Founder & Technical Head
 2nd year, COE
Aashima Garg\n Content Writer \n 2nd year, PCT

\ HISTORY 
"75 years of tradition of excellence in engineering and technology, research and innovations" Delhi College of Engineering, ( initially estabilished as - Delhi Polytechnic) came into existence in 1941. 

The institution was initially set up at the historic Kashmere Gate campus under the Wood and Abott Committee of 1938. In 1952 the college was affiliated with the University of Delhi and started degree level programs. 

The dept.of Architecture later became the School of Planning and Architecture. The dept.of Arts and Sculpture became College of Arts and the dept.s of Chemical and Textlie technology were shifted out en-block to mark the beginning of the IIT Delhi at its campus in Hauz Khas. The dept.of Commerce was later abolished and Faculty of Management Studies was estabilished. 

Thus DCE is the mother institution of IIT-D, SPA, College of Arts and FMS. Till 1962, the college was under the Ministry of Education. In 1963, its administration was handed over to the Department of Technical Education and Training, Govt.of NCT of Delhi. From July 2009, DCE became Delhi Technological University (DTU) vide Delhi Act 6 of 2009. 

The erstwhile DCE has functioned from its historic Kashmere Gate campus for almost 55 years and has shifted to its lush green sprawling campus of 164 acres at Bawana Road, adjoining Rohini Sector 17, Delhi -42 

VISION 
DTU to be a leading World Class Technology University playing its role as a key node in National and Global Knowledge Network thus empowering India with Wings of Knowledge and Power of Innovations 
The vision of DTU is : 
1. Completely Autonomous 
2. A pioneering world class university 
3. A university creating synergy between education and research . 
4. A change agent to align India s education to global standards 
5. Industrially relevant and mission oriented R&D. 
6. Impacting the community with innovative solutions to pressing problem. 

MISSION 
The mission of DTU is as follows: 
1. Be a world class centre for education, research and innovation. 
2. Promote the engineering spirit of product development . 
3. Emerge as a centre for attracting the best minds from academia and industry. 
4. Produce well rounded, socially responsible, up to date , scientifically tempered, design oriented engineers. 
5. Be able to address the impact of globalization on education. 
6. Meet the need for engineers at PG, UG and Doctoral levels. 
7. Operate DTU as a world class Knowledge Enterprise to foster teacher and student relations
